title.rendered: Top 10 Botanical Gardens of the World

content.rendered:
Do you want to experience the ultimate tranquility and calmness? Visit the repositories of extraordinary beauty at botanical gardens!

Botanical gardens are usually looked after by the research institutes and universities. The chief objective of maintaining such gardens is to document various types of plants, research, and education. Besides this, the botanical gardens are a source of great display for the nature lovers!

Known as physic gardens, the botanical gardens were originally found in the European medieval. You will be surprised to know that Chelsea Physic Garden was founded in 1673 in London remained to be a center of botanic plants supply across the world for research purpose. Over the years, researchers from horticulture and botany showed significant interest in such gardens.

Presently, a mixed theme and interests are associated with the botanical gardens of the world. Let’s see a list of such gardens to admire the beauty with the best fragrance:

 Jardim Botânico: Rio de Janeiro, Brazil:

The 140-hectare park is located at the Jardim Botânico district near the Corcovado Mountain. The garden is the home to around 6,500 rare plants. It was found in the year 1808.

Brooklyn Botanic Garden: New York, United States:

Located in the heart of the United States, the garden is 21- hectare in area. It was established in the year 1910.  The garden further divided into different inner sections, plant collections, and flower galleries. Interestingly, more than 900,000 people visit the garden annually.

Singapore Botanical Gardens: Singapore:

Stunning beauty on the surface of the planet Earth! The garden contains different inner sections including evolution garden, children’s garden, rainforest, ginger garden, terrapins, etc. it was founded in the year 1859. The garden is ranked among the best botanical gardens in the world.

Berlin-Dahlem Botanical Garden: Berlin, Germany:

A famous botanical garden based on an area of 43 hectares with several 22,000 species of plants, it opened for the public back in 1910. The garden is on the premises of the Free University of Berlin and within the garden, we can see the Botanical museum.

Royal Botanic Gardens: Kew, England:

This garden is known as the home of the world’s largest collection of plant species and the garden is spread over 300 acres of land area. There is a treetop walkway that has built to explore the park where there is an explorer train to help get around the garden as well. The Davies Alpine House is also in the garden which is based on eco-friendly technology to cater to cool weather plants. There are so many species of plants in this Botanical garden that it becomes hard to see them all in one visit. It is a heritage site by UNESCO.

Kirstenbosch National Botanical Gardens: Cape Town, South Africa:

The famous table mountains of the world have a botanical garden placed at the foot of these mountains, it was found in 1913 to safeguard and take care of the unique flowers in the country, with a wide area of 89 acres. This garden is home to indigenous plants which are very rare to find in other botanical gardens.

Montreal Botanical Garden: Montreal, Canada:

This is a Japanese garden populated with famous Japanese plants such as the collection of bonsai and penjing. Founded in the year 1931 the garden has gained popularity for the variety of oof species in the garden and the facilities for the visitors. There are also Canadian plants, the alpine garden, and many more in the 75 hectors wide garden.

Nong Nooch Tropical Botanical Garden: Chonburi Province, Thailand:

 

This parked open for the public in the late 19th century around 1980 and covers an area of 500 acres. This garden is a must-visit as it has the widest variety of plant species in a small area. It has the French garden, the garden consisting of cactus plants, butterfly hill plants, and even the orchid green plants.

Denver Botanical Gardens: Denver, United States:

This is a small botanical garden based on 23 acres of the area but has the widest variety of collection North American plants which are mainly from all the cold regions of the world. This park has mainly made its place in the best gardens due to the conservatory and the amphitheater which is used to host different events targeting environment protection.

Acharya Jagadish Chandra Bose Indian Botanic Garden: Kolkata, India:

A garden that is placed in the multicultural country of India has a variety of over 12000 species of plants. The major attraction is the theme and the setting of how different colored plants are placed to create attraction. It holds some of the rarest plant species in the world and is spread over a wide area of 109 hectors.
